page.title: 02Ecological Study of Belper
page.content: The weather of the area we studied was generally very varied. The average rainfall of the Belper area is about 28ins.per year.Winter is generally wet with variable amounts of snow, sometimes severe with long periods of frost. The last few springs have been cold. The Spring of 1985 was cold and wet. The Summer this year is terrible with dull, cool weather interrupted by outbreaks of heavy rain. Lately there has been an increasing interest in conservation as population grows and natural vegetation and woodland disappears. Pollution has been uppermost in people's minds as industry grows, car and lorry numbers increase and the air becomes more polluted with poisonous, waste gasses.Water picks up these pollutants and it falls as acid rain. Belper has one of the highest levels.
